gw.api.contact.pendingchanges

Class DiffDisplayBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.contact.pendingchanges.DiffDisplayBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GraphVisitor<EntityDiff<KeyableBean>>

    public class DiffDisplayBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements GraphVisitor<EntityDiff<KeyableBean>>
    A GraphListener that listens to visit() and edgeTraversed() events occurring in the traversal of a MergeGraph, which is a graph of KeyableBean EntityDiffs. As edges are traversed, it builds up a hierarchical composition of DiffDisplay objects representing a tree of Diff instances. Besides its children, each DiffDisplay has a reference to a Diff object. For entities, this is the EntityDiff from the original graph, which is the target of the edge being traversed. This also constructs child DiffDisplay instances linked to PropertyDiffs to represent property differences between the source and compare beans in the EntityDiff. Of course these PropertyDiff DiffDisplay children are a side-effect of a traversal from one EntityDiff to another in the original graph. They themselves have no children and so are always leaf-nodes in the final tree. Note that we only do this if the target EntityDiff is neither "added" nor "removed", meaning it is a match between the old and new sub-graphs.
    Author:
    Dventimiglia

      • getRootNode

        public DiffDisplay getRootNode()
        Bean accessor method to retrieve the root TreeNode. All other TreeNode instances are buried within hierarchically. This method is where we profit after all of our hard labor building up the tree.
        Returns:
        TreeNode for the root.
